item.title: Tania Brughera - School of Integration | Manchester Art Gallery
item.description: Life in the United Kingdom, otherwise known as the citizenship test, hasnâ€™t been with us long. Introduced in 2005, it has a reputation among both natives and non-natives for its bizarre, irrelevant and difficult questions. I first got introduced to the list at the barbers, when the Turkish and Polish staff peppered me with sample questions which, in the run-up to Brexit, they were all boning up on - and I found myself flummoxed by several of them.
